results.title: It wasn't me
results.creator_credit: Eddie Moses, John Honey, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1978 film consists of a short narrative demonstrating the need for observing industrial safety standards on building sites. The film’s cast of characters includes a wealthy contractor, a negligent foreman, a disgruntled safety warden, a foreign labourer and a department inspector, as they attempt to reconstruct what happened to a missing worker following a trench collapse. Each of the characters avoids responsibility in their roles and blames the others for the accident. Presented as a dramatic short with points of comedy (though this is mainly through the slapstick representation of an Italian worker who doesn’t speak English), the film emphasises the importance of all members of the workforce taking responsibility for upholding safe practices on site.

Produced by the Tasmania Film Corporation for the Department of Labour and Industry.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Cast: Peter Aanensen, Frank Bansel, Brendan Cassidy, Cul Cullen, Cliff Ellen, Don Glover, Peter Kay, Kevin Lacey, Robert Larkins, Sue Ellen Peers, Robert Ward

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: It wasn't easy
results.creator_credit: Nico Crama, Arthur Hammond, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Half a million people of Dutch origin live in Canada. This film looks at the unique character of the Dutch Canadians, their reasons for leaving the Netherlands and their contribution to Canadian society and culture. A cross section of Dutch Canadians living across Canada are interviewed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nico Crama, Arthur Hammond, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: It took a thief to stop a thief
results.creator_credit: Randy Grinter, Walter Shaw, Media Productions and Is Your Home Safe Inc
results.brief_description: This video covers everything from criminal attitude to locks, alarm systems, lighting, windows and position of the house. The video explores ways in which your house can be made more secure. Hosted by Walter Shaw with Eddie Egan.

results.title: It takes a lot of help
results.creator_credit: John Peer Nugent and Core Communications Group
results.brief_description: Uses music by the Beatles, with narration by Lorne Greene, to explore the numerous avenues available to groups of citizens who are concerned with preventing drug abuse. Describes various of these avenues available both to the inidividual and communities combating drug abuse.

results.title: It takes a child: Craig Kielburger's story: a journey into child labour
results.creator_credit: Judy Jackson, Deborah Parks, TV Ontario and Judy Films
results.brief_description: Canadian born Craig Kielburger was 12 years-old when child labor activist Iqbal Massih (who was also only 12 years-old) was murdered in Pakistan. That event changed Craig’s life forever. In December 1995 Craig went on a seven week journey to South Asia including India and the Philippines, to see for himself the horrific situation of child labor and children who are sold and traded on the sex tourist market. In India, the number of unemployed adults is 55 million, whilst equally, the number of child workers is 55 million. Children are leased by their parents as collateral for a loan and remain bonded to the factory owners as the debt can never be repaid. As young as 5-year-olds can work upto 12 hours a day with no schooling, barely any food and paid a pittance, if paid at all. They are slave labor working in the most inhumane conditions. What Craig saw and the knowledge he gained turned him into a passionate, articulate and incredibly effective advocate on the children’s behalf. With a group of his peers, Craig founded “Free the Children”, a children’s organization completely run by young people, that now has 10,000 members in 20 countries across the world. This documentary acknowledges Craig’s dedication and testifies to the fact that even children can help bring about change through protest and involvement. Narrated by Jennifer Dale.

results.title: It happened here
results.creator_credit: Andrew Mollo, Kevin Brownlow and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This is an imaginative realisation of a German occupation of Britain in July, 1940: Pauline Murray, an Irish girl working in England, joins up in 1944 with the re-emerging Resistance. On a 7,000 pound budget the filmmakers’ recreated a newsreel style but did not use stock or newsreel footage, a direct reaction to fifties war movies which they felt never dealt with the nature of Nazism. A controversial sequence showed real British Nazis expressing their beliefs. The documentary style drama took eight years to complete.

results.title: It happened at the world's fair
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Ted Richmond, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Turner Entertainment
results.brief_description: Friends and pilots Mike Edwards (Elvis Presley) and Danny Burke (Gary Lockwood) find themselves hitchhiking a ride with a Chinese farmer and his niece who are on their way to the World Fair in Seattle. They leave in their wake creditors, the welfare board, smugglers and a gangster, while still finding time to woo women, gamble and croon along the way. Although this is not one of Elvis’ best features, it still includes a few memorable songs such as “One broken heart for sale”, “How would you like to be” and “Take me to the fair”. Cast also includes Joan O’Brien.

results.title: It came to stay
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the motor industry in Australia from approximately 1904 and shows the significant changes that have taken place in this field. The film shows the production of motor cars from molten metal to finished product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions

results.title: Miss Congeniality
results.creator_credit: Donald Petrie, Marc Lawrence, Sandra Bullock, Fortis Film and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: FBI special agent Gracie Hart is a man’s woman - she chews with her mouth open, snorts when she laughs, has one eyebrow and is having a “bad hair decade”…So when the FBI needs to send an undercover agent into the famed Miss United States Pageant, Agent Hart certainly isn’t their first choice, she’s their only choice. Cast includes: Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, William Shatner, Candice Bergen, Benjamin Bratt.

results.title: Misleading cases
results.creator_credit: Michael O'Connell, Russell Porter and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: A dramatised film of a lecture to medical students. Professor Bruce Kerr shows the ethical dilemma in dealing with cases, of not diagnosing the medical problem correctly. Doctors should look not only at the symptoms presented by the patients but also at their social situation which may also reveal the cause. He points out that medicine is the art of insight into the human condition. (Contains footage of Northcote and University of Melbourne.)
